Class timed_mutex

boost::sync::timed_mutex

Synopsis

// In header: <boost/sync/mutexes/timed_mutex.hpp>


class timed_mutex {
public:
  // types
  typedef unspecified native_handle_type;

  // construct/copy/destruct
  timed_mutex();
  timed_mutex(timed_mutex const &) = delete;
  timed_mutex & operator=(timed_mutex const &) = delete;
  ~timed_mutex();

  // public member functions
  void lock();
  bool try_lock();
  template<typename Time> bool timed_lock(Time const &);
  template<typename Duration> bool try_lock_for(Duration const &);
  template<typename TimePoint> bool try_lock_until(TimePoint const &);
  void unlock() noexcept;
  native_handle_type native_handle() noexcept;
};

Description

timed_mutex public types

  1. typedef unspecified native_handle_type;

    Note

    This type is only available if BOOST_SYNC_DEFINES_TIMED_MUTEX_NATIVE_HANDLE macro is defined by the library.

timed_mutex public construct/copy/destruct

  1. timed_mutex();
    Default constructor.

    Creates a mutual exclusion primitive in the unlocked state.

    Throws: An exception in case if the operating system is unable to create the primitive (e.g. due to insufficient resources). 

  2. timed_mutex(timed_mutex const &) = delete;
  3. timed_mutex & operator=(timed_mutex const &) = delete;
  4. ~timed_mutex();
    Destructor.

    Destroys the mutual exclusion primitive.

    Requires:

    The primitive is in the unlocked state.

timed_mutex public member functions

  1. void lock();
    Locks the mutex.

    If the mutex is not locked, the method locks it and returns. Otherwise the method blocks until the mutex is unlocked.

    Throws: An exception in case if the operating system is unable to fulfill the request. 

  2. bool try_lock();
    Attempts to lock the mutex.

    If the mutex is not locked, the method locks it and returns true. Otherwise the method returns false.

    Throws: An exception in case if the operating system is unable to fulfill the request. 

  3. template<typename Time> bool timed_lock(Time const & time);
    Attempts to lock the mutex within the specified timeout.

    If the mutex is not locked, the method locks it and returns true. Otherwise the method blocks for up to time timeout, which can be an absolute time point or a duration. If the operation completes successfully until the timeout expires, true is returned. Otherwise, returns false.

    Throws: An exception in case if the operating system is unable to fulfill the request.

    Note

    In order to use this method, a supplementary header must be included from boost/sync/support to enable support for particular time units.

    Parameters:

    time

    Relative or absolute timeout. If timeout is relative, the time is measured according to the system clock.

    		 
  4. template<typename Duration> bool try_lock_for(Duration const & rel_timeout);
    Attempts to lock the mutex within the specified timeout.

    If the mutex is not locked, the method locks it and returns true. Otherwise the method blocks for up to time timeout, which is a duration. If the operation completes successfully until the timeout expires, true is returned. Otherwise, returns false.

    Throws: An exception in case if the operating system is unable to fulfill the request.

    Note

    In order to use this method, a supplementary header must be included from boost/sync/support to enable support for particular time units.

    Parameters:

    rel_timeout

    Relative timeout. The time is measured according to the system clock.

    		 
  5. template<typename TimePoint> 
  bool try_lock_until(TimePoint const & abs_timeout);
    Attempts to lock the mutex within the specified timeout.

    If the mutex is not locked, the method locks it and returns true. Otherwise the method blocks for up to time timeout, which is an absolute time point. If the operation completes successfully until the timeout expires, true is returned. Otherwise, returns false.

    Throws: An exception in case if the operating system is unable to fulfill the request.

    Note

    In order to use this method, a supplementary header must be included from boost/sync/support to enable support for particular time units.

    Parameters:

    abs_timeout

    Absolute timeout. If the time point clock is not compatible with system clock the operation may take considerably longer than the specified timeout.

    		 
  6. void unlock() noexcept;
    Unlocks the mutex.

    Releases the mutex that has been locked by the current thread.

    Requires:

    The mutex is locked by the current thread. 

  7. native_handle_type native_handle() noexcept;
    Returns a handle that represents a native operating system primitive that implements the mutex.
    Note

    This method is only available if BOOST_SYNC_DEFINES_TIMED_MUTEX_NATIVE_HANDLE macro is defined by the library.
